channel.title: News on Whiley Homepage
channel.description: Recent content in News on Whiley Homepage

item.title: Whiley v0.5.3 Released!
item.description: And, finally, another release of Whiley is upon us after waiting! As usual, there are a range of known issues and limitations. But, the main improvements are: Boogie Support .

item.title: Whiley v0.5.0 Released!
item.description: And, finally, another release of Whiley is upon us after some two years of waiting! As usual, there are a range of known issues and limitations. But, the main improvements are:

item.title: Whiley v0.4.2. Released!
item.description: And, after a long while, another official release of Whiley is here. This is something of an interim release whilst other things are brewing in the background. There also some known issues with this release.

item.title: Whiley v0.4.1 released!
item.description: The next release of the Whiley Development Kit is upon us. This is about six months since the last official release and, in the meantime, a lot has been going on!

item.title: Whiley v0.4.0 Released!
item.description: The next release is finally upon us. This one has been a long time coming, and its going to take a while before it settles down again!! Work on this release has been ongoing since February, though partial changes were released in v0.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.39 Released!
item.description: Progress has slowed on Whiley now that Trimester 1 and my SWEN221 class with 220+ students has begun! Despite this, development continues with more contributions from others which is great. This release is largely a “cleaning up” and “bug fixing” release, rather than landing any big features.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.38 Released!
item.description: Finally, just over one month since the last release of Whiley, version v0.3.38 is released today! The list of changes is reasonably large and we should expect lots more going forward …

item.title: Whiley v0.3.37 Released!
item.description: Another big update to Whiley landed today, and includes a whole raft of changes. In particular, various algorithms in the automated theorem prover have been reworked to improve performance (though more still needs to be done here).

item.title: Whiley v0.3.36 Released!
item.description: The next version of Whiley is upon us. Whilst predictably late, this release packs quite a punch and contains a range of changes to the language syntax, and critical updates to the verifier.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.35 Released!
item.description: Finally, a release of Whiley that is on schedule! This includes some fairly significant updates to the syntax of the language itself: Removal of set and map data types (#471).

item.title: Whiley v0.3.34 Released!
item.description: Finally, after almost two months of effort, the next version of Whiley is released. This release has taken a long time, not because it contains so much, but simply because I have been truly busy with teaching my second year paper SWEN221.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.33 Released!
item.description: The next release of Whiley is upon us!! Work got a little bogged down with the start of term, but should hopefully now pick up a little. The main component of this release is the removal of the string and char data types from the language.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.32 released!
item.description: Well, it is with some trepidation that I have released the next version of Whiley. This incorporates a very large number of changes and, unfortunately, should be considered extremely unstable at this time (at least, from the perspective of verification).

item.title: Whiley v0.3.31 Released!
item.description: The latest release is upon us, after a short break whilst I was holidaying in Europe! This includes a few simple bug fixes and updates (see #433 and #392), along with one significant feature:

item.title: Whiley v0.3.30 Released!
item.description: The next release of Whiley is now ready to be downloaded. This includes a small number of bug fixes and two more significant changes: #418 — Removal of implicit coercions.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.29 Released!
item.description: The next release of Whiley is now ready to be downloaded. This includes a number of bug fixes, along with a change in the WyIL bytecode format. The latter is ahead of further planned changes to improve the bytecode format and verification.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.28 Released!
item.description: The next release of Whiley is already upon us, after only a week or so since the last. This release consists of a slew of minor bug fixes, many of which have been discovered through students using the system in practice.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.27 Released!
item.description: The next release of Whiley is upon us. This includes a large number of bug fixes, and a significant rewrite of the verifier. Unfortunately, the verifier is not yet verifying many more examples, but it’s now placed to do so.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.26 Released!
item.description: It’s about time for another release of Whiley. This represents some interesting developments, though I continue to struggle with debugging and improving verification. The main highlights for this release are:

item.title: Whiley v0.3.24 Released!
item.description: Well, it’s time for yet another release of the Whiley compiler. This one is fairly low key, focusing primarily on bug fixes. Specifically, these issues have been resolved: #346 — Temporary Fix for Unsuported Bytecodes in the Verifier.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.23 Released!
item.description: Another update to the Whiley compiler has just been released. This is a fairly small update, consisting primarily of bug fixes. The only significant change was: Type checker now respects a variable’s declared type.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.21 Released!
item.description: This is a slightly quicker release than usual, with only a few relatively minor fixes and refactorings, etc: Factored JVM Bytecode library into a separate project, called Jasm

item.title: Whiley v0.3.20 Released!
item.description: Well, this release is about 2 months overdue, but it embodies a lot of work. The main changes are: Bug fixes. I’ve closed around 36 issues, many of which were intricate little bugs.

item.title: Whiley v0.3.3 Released!
item.description: This latest update of Whiley is a somewhat minor increment over the previous. Aside from a number of bug fixes the main improvement is the inclusion of first-class functions (aka function pointers).
